file_content.text: Those people need you and Zenith. I just hope he restrains himself.
With the corporations' support, we're secure enough to begin the next stage of my plan.
Word is our current president, Galthe, is "ill." He's rarely seen, and Darth Lachris says she's acting on his behalf. But I need him.
Unless President Galthe publicly signs over power to me, becoming president will be difficult.
His endorsement seems like a small thing beside the might of the corporations.
Why is that?
President Galthe is well-loved by Balmorra's people. Without his approval, or fall, they'll never trust us.
Do we know where Darth Lachris is holding President Galthe?
Then we rescue him.
She keeps him out of sight. There are rumors, nothing concrete yet.
If he's already in office, why don't we just get rid of Darth Lachris?
Can't he stay president?
If Galthe is still fit for the position, we'd welcome him. But after so long....
Trouble. Informant in Sobrik just recorded this speech. From Darth Lachris.
... by our dear president, after these rumors of a new anarchist government, we are pursuing executive order 228.
Using it, we've unmasked dozens of resistance accomplices hiding amongst us. But rest assured, they are already at our holding facility.
Once they're punished for their crimes, Balmorra's future will be bright again!
Darth Lachris enjoys rounding up innocents. Set a trap for a Jedi, kill the prisoners if no one takes the bait. Win-win for her.
Maybe Darth Lachris doesn't know how many followers you have. Together we could catch her off guard.
Help me save them.
Good idea. We must make sure those people are safe, first.
We draw off the Imperials, you grab the civilians. Right?
That will not happen.
Your people should have risen up against Darth Lachris long ago.
Why has no one killed her yet?
Some tried. We call them martyrs.
Hmm. She'll expect one Jedi, but I have allies in hiding. We'll draw the Imperials out, you get the civilians. Plausible?
Sounds possible. May the Force be with us.
I hope it's that simple.
Good. Where are we headed?
You and your friends had better know what you're doing.
Don't let me down.
Done okay so far.
Thank you, both of you. We'll start arrangements to send those people into hiding.
I know this "holding facility"--death trap. Here's the location. My men and I will go on ahead.
Don't forget what we're risking for you, Tai. Because I won't.
We've been receiving the stockpile data--it's better than I hoped. Look, Director Fenn already sent droids for protection.
I heard you and Zenith threatened Fenn's family. Was that necessary? What if the corporations rebel later?
Director Fenn will understand, once Balmorra is free.
I'm sure they won't.
I hope so, I can't afford any more enemies.
Let's move on.
Be a leader. Deal with it.
I suppose I'll soon have issues like this every day.
Oh, and Master Syo Bakarn wanted to speak to you.
Yes. I heard Director Fenn requested a halt to Jedi supervision of their weapons research, and that you agreed.
Antagonizing those corporations could have endangered my entire mission.
I had to, Master Syo.
I did, and I'm sorry.
Very well. You are newly promoted, after all.
I was there, unlike the Jedi Council. Better my decision than none.
I stand by my choice.
This is a troubling start to your time as a Master.
Yes. I hear you negotiated with the corporations, allowing us to supervise their weapons research.
An admirable effort, but I wonder if a few Jedi overseers can restrain them.
Even a single Jedi's attention will make them think twice.
I'm sure they can.
This way, the corporations are supervised, but we keep their goodwill.
It's the best solution.
I see you've thought carefully on this. I trust your judgment.
That's your worry, not mine.
You should not dismiss consequences so lightly.
I have Core Worlds business to attend to. Go well.
Please hurry. Director Fenn is waiting for you outside Sobrik.
Balmorra's strength is in the huge corporations here. They have money, political pull and military droids.
So far, the Empire has left the corporations alone, in return for "donations" of weapons and credits.
They must be made to realize that they only exist at the Empire's whim.
Corporations like to be free.
...and they'll be eager to change that.
Those weapons and funds would greatly improve our own position.
Could they "donate" to us?
If these corporations are arming Imperial soldiers, they're the enemy.
So they're collaborators.
The Jedi is right.
After you both... handled that Imperial official, I called my old corporate contacts here. We have their attention.
Their resources are invaluable to building our new government. I want their commitment.
If the Empire finds out, the corporations will be purged.
This a huge risk for them.
Which they understand, so they're driving a hard bargain.
So how do we get it?
They might see greater profit in turning us over to the Empire.
Can we trust them?
Yes, but I offer freedom--plus a whole Republic of customers.
Director Fenn is head of Troida, and speaks for the other companies. He's asked to discuss a deal with us.
There's an old records vault outside Sobrik he's chosen for the meet. I'd like you to convince him to help.
I hope to be a worthy representative for you.
I will do my best.
No problem at all.
I'm sure I can make this Director Fenn see reason.
I can be very persuasive.
The Empire watches everyone important. Fenn will have Imperial droids escorting him. For "protection."
Destroy them quickly, or they'll report you to the Empire. Then it's over.
Excellent work! Two of my colleagues have already returned from exile. And we can work safely here.
Plotting to give Balmorra to the Republic. One occupation replaced by another.
But we both want the Empire gone. Our goal is the same. For now.
Unless we work as allies, we can't free Balmorra.
We must trust each other.
Well said, and one of the pillars of my plan.
We must act now before the Empire realizes what's happening.
Then let's strike quickly.
Without our strategy, you're just a radical throwing bombs and writing slogans.
Admit it, you need us.
Whatever works. What's Tai's alternative?
That was not your decision to make.
